etymology.description: 气(氣) (qì, "air; gas") refers to air or gas, often considered the vital force in traditional Chinese thought. 泡(泡) (pào, "bubble") signifies a bubble. Combined, 气泡(氣泡) (qìpào) refers to an "air bubble" as it is a bubble filled with air.
etymology.interpretation: The word 气泡(氣泡) (qìpào) directly combines the concepts of air and a bubble, clearly describing a bubble filled with air.

examples.chinese: 气泡在水中闪烁(氣泡在水中閃爍)。
examples.english: Air bubbles shimmer in the water.

examples.chinese: 他喝汽水时(他喝汽水時)，欣赏气泡上升(欣賞氣泡上升)。
examples.pinyin: tā hē qìshuǐ shí, xīnshǎng qìpào shàngshēng.
examples.english: He admires the rising air bubbles while drinking soda.
